messages.title: The Tories have pushed the NHS into crisis.
messages.content: Under the Tories, the NHS has struggled to cope with soaring demand amid a staffing emergency. We've all heard stories about patients left waiting along in pain, and ambulances queued up outside A&E. We've seen how a lack of proper planning and investment in social care has shifted costs onto the NHS and stalled patients' release from hospital.

messages.title: The NHS was created to care for us all.
messages.content: Only Labour will give the NHS the funding it needs.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will give the NHS the funding it needs. Take one million people off NHS waiting lists by guaranteeing that patients can be seen in A&E within four hours.
Tackle the staffing crisis, starting with a pay rise for NHS workers.
Provide a new Â£500 million annual fund for improving patient care.

issues.health: Under the Tories, the NHS has struggled to cope with soaring demand amid a staffing emergency, resulting in patients left waiting alone in pain, and ambulances queued up outside A&E.
issues.socialWelfare: A lack of proper planning and investment in social care has shifted costs onto the NHS and stalled patients' release from hospital.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Leaflet focuses on the NHS, with mentions of A&E, social care, and the Labour Party's plans to address systematic issues within the health service.
